items.name: AimPunchProfile
items.summary: A settings profile for an aim punch effect.

items.name: strength
items.summary:
The strength of the aim punch. The higher the value, the
more the camera will be offset.

items.name: decayRate
items.summary:
How quickly the aim punch returns to zero. The higher the
value, the faster the aim punch will return to zero.

items.name: directionMin
items.summary:
The minimum direction the camera moves when aim punched. A
random value between the min and max is chosen each time.

items.name: directionMax
items.summary:
The maximum direction the camera moves when aim punched. A
random value between the min and max is chosen each time.

items.name: AimPunchSettings
items.summary: Settings for an aim punch effect.

syntax.content:
[Serializable]
public sealed class AimPunchSettings : CameraEffectSettings<AimPunch, AimPunchProfile>

items.name: AnimatorMotionSettings
items.summary: Settings for an animator motion modifier.

items.name: offset
items.summary: An additional offset to apply to the animator motion.

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly the motion is applied to the camera. Small numbers
respond more quickly while large numbers respond more slowly.

items.name: AutoFocus
items.summary: Changes the depth of field based on where the camera is looking.

items.name: focusDistance
items.summary: The current depth of field focus distance (Read only).

items.name: AutoFocusMode
items.summary: A type of auto focus mode.

items.name: ThirdPerson
items.summary: Focuses the camera on the tracked target object.

items.name: FirstPerson
items.summary: Focuses the camera on the object being looked at.

items.name: AutoFocusSettings
items.summary: Settings for a depth of field effect.

items.name: focusMode
items.summary: The type of focus mode to use.

items.name: raycastLayers
items.summary: The layers that are hit by the camera's raycast.

items.name: postProcessingLayer
items.summary: The layer the post processing effect should be applied to.

items.name: aperture
items.summary:
The ratio of aperture (known as f-stop or f-number). The smaller
the value, the shallower the depth of field is.

items.name: focalLength
items.summary:
The distance between the lens and the film. The larger the
value, the shallower the depth of field is.

items.name: focusTime
items.summary: The amount of seconds it takes the camera to change focus distance.

items.name: distanceRange
items.summary: The minimum and maximum focus distance.

items.name: CameraBehavior<T>
items.summary:
The base class for all camera behaviors which are enabled and disabled
based on the settings of the behavior.

syntax.content: public abstract class CameraBehavior<T> : CameraProcess where T : CameraBehaviorSettings, new()

typeParameters.description: The type of settings for the behavior.

items.name: settings
items.summary: The settings for the behavior.

items.name: enabled
items.summary: Enables or disables the behavior from being updated.

items.name: OnEnable()
items.summary: A callback invoked when the behavior is enabled.

items.name: OnDisable()
items.summary: A callback invoked when the behavior is disabled.

items.name: StartCoroutine(IEnumerator)
items.summary: Starts a coroutine.

parameters.description: The routine to start.

return.description: A reference to the coroutine.

items.name: StopCoroutine(Coroutine)
items.summary: Stops a coroutine.

parameters.description: The routine to stop.

items.name: Invoke(String, Single)
items.summary: Invokes a method after a set delay.

syntax.content: protected void Invoke(string methodName, float time)

parameters.description: The name of the method to invoke.
The delay in seconds before invoking the method.

items.name: InvokeRepeating(String, Single, Single)
items.summary: Invokes a method after a set delay then repeats at a set rate.

syntax.content: protected void InvokeRepeating(string methodName, float time, float repeatRate)

parameters.description: The name of the method to invoke.
The delay in seconds before invoking the method.
The repeated rate in seconds at which to invoke the method.

items.name: CancelInvoke(String)
items.summary: Cancels all invoke calls with the specified method name.

parameters.description: The name of the method to cancel.

items.name: IsInvoking(String)
items.summary: Checks if any invoke is pending for the specified method name.

parameters.description: The name of the method to check.

return.description: True if any invoke is pending for the specified method name.

items.name: CameraBehaviorSettings<T>
items.summary: The base class for camera behavior settings of a specified type.

syntax.content:
[Serializable]
public abstract class CameraBehaviorSettings<T> : CameraBehaviorSettings where T : CameraProcess, new()

typeParameters.description: The type of behavior associated with the settings.

items.name: CameraBehaviorSettings
items.summary: The base class for all camera behavior settings.

items.name: CameraCollision
items.summary: Detects collision and adjusts the camera's position accordingly.

items.name: CameraCollisionSettings
items.summary: Settings for camera collision.

items.name: occlusionMask
items.summary: The physics layers that are hit by the camera's raycasts.

items.name: cameraRadius
items.summary:
The radius of the camera to indicate how close it can get to an
object before colliding.

items.name: dampingIn
items.summary:
How quickly the camera changes position when collision causes
the camera to move closer to the subject. Smaller numbers make
the camera move quicker.

items.name: dampingOut
items.summary:
How quickly the camera changes position when collision causes
the camera to move further from the subject. Smaller numbers
make the camera move quicker.

items.name: resetDelay
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes before the camera resets to its
normal position after collisions are resolved.

items.name: minOcclusionDistance
items.summary:
The minimum occlusion distance from the camera. Sometimes you
want to leave at least a little bit of space between the camera
and the character when occluding.

items.name: CameraContext
items.summary: A context object that represents a camera's state.

items.name: rotationModifiers
items.summary: Modifiers that alter the camera rotation.

items.name: positionModifiers
items.summary: Modifiers that alter the camera position.

items.name: trackingModifiers
items.summary: Modifiers that alter the tracking point.

items.name: rotationOverride
items.summary: Overrides the camera's rotation to the specified value.

items.name: positionOverride
items.summary: Overrides the camera's position to the specified value.

items.name: lookRotation
items.summary: The look rotation of the camera expressed as a quaternion.

items.name: modifiedRotation
items.summary: The look rotation of the camera with modifiers applied (Read only).

items.name: trackingPoint
items.summary: The position the camera is tracking.

items.name: modifiedTrackingPoint
items.summary: The position the camera is tracking with modifiers applied (Read only).

items.name: distance
items.summary:
The distance between the camera and the pivot point while factoring
in occlusion and the min and max distance (Read only).

items.name: distanceOffset
items.summary:
The distance vector between the camera and the pivot point while
factoring in occlusion and the min and max distance (Read only).

items.name: minDistance
items.summary: The minimum distance the camera can be from the pivot point.

items.name: maxDistance
items.summary: The maximum distance the camera can be from the pivot point.

items.name: pivotDistance
items.summary: The intended distance between the camera and the pivot point.

items.name: occlusionDistance
items.summary: The amount of distance the camera is adjusted due to occlusion.

items.name: GetTransform(out Vector3, out Quaternion)
items.summary: Calculates the camera position and rotation from the context values.

syntax.content: public void GetTransform(out Vector3 position, out Quaternion rotation)

parameters.description: The output position of the camera.
The output rotation of the camera.

items.name: GetUnmodifiedTransform(out Vector3, out Quaternion)
items.summary:
Calculates the camera position and rotation from the context values
without applying any modifiers or overrides.

syntax.content: public void GetUnmodifiedTransform(out Vector3 position, out Quaternion rotation)

parameters.description: The output position of the camera.
The output rotation of the camera.

items.name: ResetOverrides()
items.summary: Resets any position or rotation overrides applied during the last frame.

items.name: CameraController
items.summary: Controls and handles the behaviors of a camera.

items.name: camera
items.summary: The camera that is being controlled.

items.name: cameraRotation
items.summary: The current rotation of the camera (Read only).

items.name: cameraPosition
items.summary: The current position of the camera (Read only).

items.name: cameraForward
items.summary: The current forward axis of the camera (Read only).

items.name: profile
items.summary: The instanced camera settings profile used by the controller.

items.name: sharedProfile
items.summary: The shared camera settings profile used by the controller.

items.name: trackingTarget
items.summary: The transform the camera is tracking.

items.name: context
items.summary: The current camera context / state.

items.name: processes
items.summary: The camera process manager for the controller.

items.name: input
items.summary: The camera input manager for the controller.

items.name: ui
items.summary: The camera UI manager for the controller.

items.name: SetProfile(CameraProfile)
items.summary: Applies the camera settings profile to the controller.

parameters.description: The profile to apply.

items.name: SetTrackingTarget(Transform)
items.summary: Sets the camera tracking target.

parameters.description: The transform to track.

items.name: GetProcess<T>()
items.summary: Returns the camera process of the specified type.

syntax.content:
public T GetProcess<T>()
    where T : CameraProcess

return.description: The camera process of the specified type, or null if not registered.

typeParameters.description: The type of the process to retrieve.

items.name: CameraCursor
items.summary: Changes the mouse cursor settings.

items.name: CameraCursorSettings
items.summary: Settings for the camera cursor.

items.name: enabledState
items.summary: The cursor state when the behavior is enabled.

items.name: disabledState
items.summary: The cursor state when the behavior is disabled.

items.name: CameraEffectExtensions
items.summary: Extension methods for <xref href="Zigurous.Cameras.ICameraEffect" data-throw-if-not-resolved="false"></xref>.

items.name: Activate(ICameraEffect, String)
items.summary: Activates the effect with the given profile.

syntax.content: public static void Activate(this ICameraEffect effect, string profile)

parameters.description: The effect to activate.
The name of the profile to activate with.

items.summary: Activates the effect with the given profile.

syntax.content: public static void Activate(this ICameraEffect effect, int profile)

parameters.description: The effect to activate.
The index of the profile to activate with.

items.name: Deactivate(ICameraEffect, String)
items.summary: Deactivates the effect with the given profile.

syntax.content: public static void Deactivate(this ICameraEffect effect, string profile)

parameters.description: The effect to deactivate.
The name of the profile to deactivate with.

items.name: Deactivate(ICameraEffect, Int32)
items.summary: Deactivates the effect with the given profile.

syntax.content: public static void Deactivate(this ICameraEffect effect, int profile)

parameters.description: The effect to deactivate.
The index of the profile to deactivate with.

items.name: Toggle(ICameraEffect)
items.summary: Toggles the effect's active state.

syntax.content: public static void Toggle(this ICameraEffect effect)

items.name: SetDefaultProfile(ICameraEffect)
items.summary:
Sets the profile named "Default" to be active or the first profile
in the list if not found.

syntax.content: public static bool SetDefaultProfile(this ICameraEffect effect)

parameters.description: The effect to set the profile for.

return.description: True if the profile was set, false otherwise.

items.name: CameraEffectProfile
items.summary: The base class for camera effect profiles.

items.name: name
items.summary: The name of the settings profile.

items.name: CameraEffectProfile(String)
items.summary: Creates a new profile with the given name.

parameters.description: The name of the profile.

items.name: CameraEffectSettings<T>
items.summary: The base class for all camera effect settings.

syntax.content:
[Serializable]
public abstract class CameraEffectSettings<T> : CameraBehaviorSettings where T : CameraEffectProfile

typeParameters.description: The profile type to use for the effect.

items.name: profiles
items.summary: The settings profiles available to use.

items.name: CameraEffectSettings<T, U>
items.summary: The base class for camera effect settings of a specified type.

typeParameters.description: The type of behavior associated with the settings.
The profile type to use for the settings.

items.name: CameraFadeProfile
items.summary: A settings profile for a camera fade effect.

items.name: fadeIn
items.summary: The transition settings for fading in the camera.

items.name: fadeOut
items.summary: The transition settings for fading out the camera.

items.name: CameraFadeSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera fade effect.

syntax.content:
[Serializable]
public sealed class CameraFadeSettings : CameraEffectSettings<CameraFade, CameraFadeProfile>

items.name: CameraFadeTransition
items.summary: Settings for a fade transition.

items.name: color
items.summary: The color of the fade.

items.name: duration
items.summary: The amount of seconds it takes to fade the camera.

items.name: curve
items.summary: The animation curve to use for fading the camera.

items.name: CameraFollow
items.summary: Moves and rotates the camera to follow a tracked object.

items.name: followPosition
items.summary: The current tracked follow position (Read only).

items.name: lookRotation
items.summary: The current tracked look rotation (Read only).

items.name: GetTrackingData(CameraContext, Transform, Vector3, out Vector3, out Quaternion)
items.nameWithType: CameraFollow.GetTrackingData(CameraContext, Transform, Vector3, out Vector3, out Quaternion)
items.summary: Calculates the tracking point and tracking rotation for the camera.

syntax.content: public static void GetTrackingData(CameraContext context, Transform target, Vector3 offset, out Vector3 trackingPoint, out Quaternion trackingRotation)

parameters.description: The camera context.
The target to track.
The offset from the target.
The output tracking point.
The output tracking rotation.

items.name: CameraFollowSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera follow behavior.

items.name: offset
items.summary:
The camera offset in the tracking target's local space. Use this
to fine-tune the tracking position when the desired position is
not the center of the target.

items.name: moveTracking
items.summary: Moves the camera to follow the target.

items.name: moveDamping
items.summary:
How quickly the camera follows the tracking target. Small
numbers make the camera follow the target more closely.

items.name: lookTracking
items.summary: Rotates the camera to look at the tracking target.

items.name: lookDamping
items.summary:
How quickly the camera looks toward tracking target. Small
numbers make the camera respond more quickly.

items.name: lookDelay
items.summary:
The amount of seconds before the camera starts automatically
looking at the tracking target after the player has manually
looked away. A value of infinity disables this behavior.

items.name: CameraFreeFly
items.summary: Handles free fly camera movement.

items.name: direction
items.summary: The direction the camera is flying in local space (Read only).

items.name: speed
items.summary: The current speed of the camera (Read only).

items.name: fast
items.summary: Whether fast mode is activated (Read only).

items.name: slow
items.summary: Whether slow mode is activated (Read only).

items.name: CameraFreeFlyInputSettings
items.summary: Input settings for a camera free fly behavior.

items.name: axisX
items.summary: Handles moving on the x axis.

items.name: axisY
items.summary: Handles moving on the y axis.

items.name: axisZ
items.summary: Handles moving on the z axis.

items.name: buttonFast
items.summary: Makes the camera move faster when activated.

items.name: buttonSlow
items.summary: Makes the camera move slower when activated.

items.name: CameraFreeFlySettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera free fly behavior.

items.name: input
items.summary: The input settings.

items.name: speed
items.summary: The speed settings.

items.name: CameraFreeFlySpeedSettings
items.summary: Speed settings for a camera free fly behavior.

items.name: baseSpeed
items.summary: The base speed at which the camera moves.

items.name: fastMultiplier
items.summary: The speed multiplier when fast speed is active.

items.name: slowMultiplier
items.summary: The speed multiplier when slow speed is active.

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly the camera responds to changes in movement. Small
numbers make the camera more responsive. Larger numbers make the
camera respond more slowly.

items.name: CameraFreeLook
items.summary: Handles looking around while orbiting a pivot point.

items.name: input
items.summary: The look input axis values (Read only).

items.name: CameraFreeLookAxis
items.summary: Settings for a look axis.

items.name: input
items.summary: The input axis.

items.name: range
items.summary: The minimum and maximum angle of the look axis.

items.name: initialAngle
items.summary: The initial angle of the look axis.

items.name: CameraFreeLookAxis(String, Single, Single)
items.summary: Creates new axis settings.

syntax.content: public CameraFreeLookAxis(string input, float min, float max)

parameters.description: The input axis name.
The minimum value of the axis.
The maximum value of the axis.

items.name: CameraFreeLookSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera free look behavior.

items.name: xAxis
items.summary: The x-axis settings.

items.name: yAxis
items.summary: The y-axis settings.

items.name: CameraInputManager
items.summary: Manages and reads input from the player.

items.name: settings
items.summary: The input settings used by the manager.

items.name: enabled
items.summary: Turns on/off input handling.

items.name: inputHandler
items.summary: The active input handler.

items.name: GetAxis(InputAxis)
items.summary: Gets the input value for the specified input axis.

parameters.description: The input axis to read.

return.description: The input value.

items.name: GetButtonPressed(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was pressed during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was pressed during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonReleased(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was released during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was released during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonHeld(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was held down during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was held down during this frame.

items.name: CameraInputSettings
items.summary: Settings for the camera input manager.

items.name: handlerType
items.summary: The input handler type to use.

items.name: customHandler
items.summary: The custom input handler to use.

items.name: CameraModifier<T>
items.summary: A camera behavior that applies a transform modifier to the camera.

syntax.content: public abstract class CameraModifier<T> : CameraBehavior<T> where T : CameraBehaviorSettings, new()

typeParameters.description: The type of settings for the behavior.

items.name: GetRotationModifier()
items.summary: Gets the rotation modifier of the behavior.

return.description: The current rotation modifier.

items.name: GetPositionModifier()
items.summary: Gets the position modifier of the behavior.

return.description: The current position modifier.

items.name: GetTrackingModifier()
items.summary: Gets the tracking modifier of the behavior.

return.description: The current tracking modifier.

items.name: SetRotationModifier(Quaternion)
items.summary: Sets the rotation modifier of the behavior.

parameters.description: The new rotation modifier.

items.name: SetPositionModifier(Vector3)
items.summary: Sets the position modifier of the behavior.

parameters.description: The new position modifier.

items.name: SetTrackingModifier(Vector3)
items.summary: Sets the tracking modifier of the behavior.

parameters.description: The new tracking modifier.

items.name: RemoveRotationModifier()
items.summary: Removes the rotation modifier of the behavior.

items.name: RemovePositionModifier()
items.summary: Removes the position modifier of the behavior.

items.name: RemoveTrackingModifier()
items.summary: Removes the tracking modifier of the behavior.

items.name: CameraPanning
items.summary: Pans the camera around on the XZ plane usually from mouse input.

items.name: position
items.summary: The current camera pan position (Read only).

items.name: startTime
items.summary: The time at which the camera started panning (Read only).

items.name: stopTime
items.summary: The time at which the camera stopped panning (Read only).

items.name: panning
items.summary: Whether the camera is currently panning (Read only).

items.name: CameraPanningSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera panning behavior.

items.name: inputAxisX
items.summary: The input axis for panning on the x-axis.

items.name: inputAxisY
items.summary: The input axis for panning on the y-axis.

items.name: inputButton
items.summary:
The input button to hold down to allow panning. If left empty, no
button is required.

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly the camera responds to changes in movement. Larger
numbers make the camera move more smoothly.

items.name: resetTime
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes the camera to reset back to the
tracking point after panning stops.

items.name: CameraPreset
items.summary: A preset for a camera settings profile.

items.name: CameraPresetExtensions
items.summary: Extension methods for <xref href="Zigurous.Cameras.CameraPreset" data-throw-if-not-resolved="false"></xref>.

items.name: CreateProfile(CameraPreset)
items.summary: Creates a new camera settings profile from the specified preset.

syntax.content: public static CameraProfile CreateProfile(this CameraPreset preset)

parameters.description: The preset to create the profile from.

return.description: The new camera settings profile.

items.name: CameraProcess
items.summary:
The base class for all camera processes which are registered to a camera
controller and are updated every frame by the controller.

items.name: controller
items.summary: The camera controller handling the process.

items.name: registered
items.summary: Whether the process has been registered to a controller.

items.name: order
items.summary:
Determines the order in which processes are handled. The process
with the lowest order value is handled first.

items.name: id
items.summary: The unique identifier of the camera process.

items.name: OnRegister(CameraController)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the process is registered to a controller.

parameters.description: The controller the process was registered to.

items.name: OnUnregister(CameraController)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the process is unregistered from a controller.

parameters.description: The controller the process was unregistered from.

items.name: OnUpdate(CameraController, CameraContext)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the process is updated.

syntax.content: protected virtual void OnUpdate(CameraController controller, CameraContext context)

parameters.description: The controller the process is being updated on.
The current camera context.

items.name: OnCameraProfileChanged(CameraProfile, CameraProfile)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the camera profile changes.

syntax.content: protected virtual void OnCameraProfileChanged(CameraProfile newProfile, CameraProfile oldProfile)

parameters.description: The new camera profile.
The previous camera profile.

items.name: OnTrackingTargetChanged(Transform)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the tracking target changes.

parameters.description: The new tracking target.

items.name: CameraProcessManager
items.summary: Manages the camera processes for a camera controller.

items.name: Count
items.summary: The number of processes registered to the controller.

items.name: Item[Int32]
items.summary: Gets the process at the specified index.

parameters.description: The index of the process to get.

return.description: The process at the specified index.

items.name: CameraProcessManager(CameraController)
items.summary: Initializes the camera process manager for the specified controller.

parameters.description: The controller to initialize the manager for.

items.summary: Returns the camera process of the specified type.

syntax.content:
public T Get<T>()
    where T : CameraProcess

return.description: The camera process of the specified type, or null if not registered.

typeParameters.description: The type of the process to retrieve.

items.name: Register<T>()
items.summary: Registers a process to the controller of the specified type.

syntax.content:
public T Register<T>()
    where T : CameraProcess, new()

return.description: The registered process.

typeParameters.description: The type of process to register.

items.name: Register(CameraProcess)
items.summary: Registers a process to the controller.

parameters.description: The process to register.

return.description: True if the process was registered, false if not.

items.name: Unregister<T>()
items.summary: Unregisters a process from the controller of the specified type.

syntax.content:

    where T : CameraProcess

return.description: True if the process was unregistered, false if not.

typeParameters.description: The type of process to unregister.

items.name: Unregister(CameraProcess)
items.summary: Unregisters a process from the controller.

parameters.description: The process to unregister.

return.description: True if the process was unregistered, false if not.

items.name: Clear()
items.summary: Clears all of the processes from the controller.

items.name: AddSettings<T>(Boolean)
items.summary: Adds the settings of the specified type to the profile.

    where T : CameraSettings, new()

parameters.description: Whether the settings behavior is enabled (default=true).

    where T : CameraSettings

items.name: CameraSettings
items.summary: The base class for all camera settings.

items.name: active
items.summary:
Whether the settings are active on a camera profile. Inactive
settings will not display in the editor.

items.name: enabled
items.summary:
Turns on or off the settings behavior. Enabled behaviors are updated
every frame.

items.name: isActiveAndEnabled
items.summary: Whether the settings are active and enabled.

items.name: OnActivate(CameraController)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the settings are activated on a controller.

parameters.description: The controller that activated the settings.

items.name: OnDeactivate(CameraController)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the settings are deactivated on a controller.

parameters.description: The controller that deactivated the settings.

items.name: CameraShakeProfile
items.summary: A settings profile for a camera shake effect.

items.name: duration
items.summary: The amount of seconds the camera shake lasts.

items.name: acceleration
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes the camera shake to
accelerate to full strength.

items.name: deceleration
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes the camera shake to decay
back to zero.

items.name: frequency
items.summary:
The frequency of the noise function. A higher value results
in a quicker shake due to more frequent changes in noise
values.

items.name: amplitude
items.summary:
The amplitude of the noise function. A higher value results
in a more intense shake due to larger spikes in noise
values.

items.name: positionalMagnitude
items.summary: How much the camera shake impacts the position of the camera.

items.name: rotationalMagnitude
items.summary: How much the camera shake impacts the rotation of the camera.

items.name: CameraShakeSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera shake effect.

syntax.content:
[Serializable]
public sealed class CameraShakeSettings : CameraEffectSettings<CameraShake, CameraShakeProfile>

items.name: CameraTargeting
items.summary: Allows the camera to track targetable objects.

items.name: target
items.summary: The transform the camera is currently targeting.

items.name: targetPosition
items.summary: The position of the transform the camera is currently targeting.

items.name: locating
items.summary: The locating module of the camera targeting behavior.

items.name: lookAt
items.summary: The look at module of the camera targeting behavior.

items.name: lineOfSight
items.summary: The line of sight module of the camera targeting behavior.

items.name: switching
items.summary: The switching module of the camera targeting behavior.

items.name: recentering
items.summary: The recentering module of the camera targeting behavior.

items.name: userInterface
items.summary: The UI module of the camera targeting behavior.

items.name: TryTargeting(Transform)
items.summary:
Attempts to target the given transform if it is within the target
radius and line of sight.

return.description: True if the transform was targeted, false otherwise.

items.name: Target(Transform)
items.summary: Targets the given transform.

parameters.description: The transform to target.

items.name: Untarget()
items.summary: Untargets the current target.

items.name: CameraTargetingInputSettings
items.summary: Input settings for a camera targeting behavior.

items.name: lockOnButton
items.summary: The input button to lock on a target.

items.name: requireHold
items.summary: Requires the input button to be held down to continue targeting.

items.name: CameraTargetingLineOfSightModule
items.summary: A camera targeting module to check for line of sight of objects.

items.name: timeLastVisible
items.summary: The time the active target was last in sight.

items.name: IsVisible(Transform)
items.summary:
Determines if a transform is visible from the position of another
transform.

parameters.description: The transform to check if visible.

return.description: True if the target is visible.

items.name: CameraTargetingLineOfSightSettings
items.summary:
Settings for a camera targeting module to indicate how the camera checks
if a target is visible.

items.name: obstacles
items.summary: The layer(s) of the obstacles that can occlude the target.

items.name: maxDistance
items.summary: The maximum distance the camera can see targets.

items.name: outOfSightTime
items.summary:
The amount of seconds the target can remain out of sight before
the camera stops targeting it. This is useful to ensure the
camera does not stop targeting the object if it is occluded for
only a brief second.

items.name: updateInterval
items.summary:
The amount of seconds between line of sight checks (used for
optimization purposes).

items.name: CameraTargetingLocatingModule
items.summary: A camera targeting module to locate targets within the camera's view.

items.name: FindNearestTarget()
items.summary: Finds the nearest targetable transform within the camera's view frustum.

return.description: The transform that can be targeted, or null otherwise.

items.name: FindNearestTargetRight()
items.summary:
Finds the nearest targetable transform within the camera's view
frustum to the right of the current target.

return.description: The transform that can be targeted, or null otherwise.

items.name: FindNearestTargetLeft()
items.summary:
Finds the nearest targetable transform within the camera's view
frustum to the left of the current target.

return.description: The transform that can be targeted, or null otherwise.

items.name: CameraTargetingLocatingSettings
items.summary:
Settings for a camera targeting module to indicate how the camera
locates targets.

items.name: targetableLayers
items.summary: The layer(s) of the objects that can targeted.

items.name: radius
items.summary: The maximum distance objects can be targeted from the camera.

items.name: maxTargets
items.summary:
The maximum amount of targets to locate within a single search (used
for optimization purposes).

items.name: CameraTargetingLookAtModule
items.summary: A camera targeting module that rotates the camera to look at the target.

items.name: CameraTargetingLookAtSettings
items.summary:
Settings for a camera targeting module to indicate how the camera looks
at targeted objects.

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly the camera looks at the target. Smaller values make
the camera look at the target more quickly.

items.name: maxSpeed
items.summary: The max speed the camera can rotate to look at the target.

items.name: CameraTargetingModule<T>
items.summary: The base class for all camera targeting modules.

syntax.content: public abstract class CameraTargetingModule<T> : CameraBehavior<T> where T : CameraTargetingModuleSettings, new()

typeParameters.description: The type of settings for the module.

items.name: parent
items.summary: The camera targeting behavior the module belongs to.

items.name: OnTargetChanged(Transform, Transform)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the camera target has changed.

syntax.content: protected virtual void OnTargetChanged(Transform newTarget, Transform oldTarget)

parameters.description: The new target.
The old target.

items.name: CameraTargetingModuleSettings
items.summary: The base class for all camera targeting module settings.

items.name: CameraTargetingRecenteringModule
items.summary:
A camera targeting module that resets the rotation of the camera to face
the default forward direction when not targeting an object.

items.name: CameraTargetingRecenteringSettings
items.summary:
Settings for a camera targeting module to indicate how the camera
recenters back to a forward position.

items.name: recenterTime
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes the camera to recenter to the
forward direction.

items.name: maxSpeed
items.summary: The max speed the camera can move to recenter.

items.name: CameraTargetingSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera targeting behavior.

items.name: input
items.summary: Settings to indicate user input.

items.name: locating
items.summary: Settings to indicate how the camera locates targets.

items.name: lookAt
items.summary: Settings to indicate how the camera looks at targeted objects.

items.name: lineOfSight
items.summary: Settings to indicate how the camera checks if a target is visible.

items.name: switching
items.summary: Settings to indicate how the camera switches between targets.

items.name: recentering
items.summary: Settings to indicate how the camera recenters back to a forward position.

items.name: userInterface
items.summary: Settings to indicate how the camera displays tracking UI.

items.name: CameraTargetingSwitchingModule
items.summary:
A camera targeting module that handles switching to new targets to the
left or right of the current target. The module also marks new targets
as "sticky" so they cannot be switched from too quickly on accident.

items.name: sticky
items.summary: Whether the current target is sticky and thus cannot be changed.

items.name: CameraTargetingSwitchingSettings
items.summary:
Settings for a camera targeting module to indicate how the camera
switches between targets.

items.name: stickyDuration
items.summary:
The amount of seconds before another target can be switched to. This
ensures targets are not switched to accidentally based on the
sensitivity of the input device.

items.name: inputSensitivity
items.summary:
The sensitivity multiplier applied to inputs to prevent switching
targets too quickly.

items.name: inputDecay
items.summary:
The rate at which input values decay back to zero. The decay is used
to force a quick input movement rather than a continuous slow
movement.

items.name: CameraTargetingUIModule
items.summary: A camera targeting module that displays UI while targeting objects.

items.name: content
items.summary: The UI content being displayed.

items.name: CameraTargetingUISettings
items.summary:
Settings for a camera targeting module to indicate how the camera
displays tracking UI.

items.name: prefab
items.summary: The UI content to instantiate.

items.name: tracking
items.summary: Changes the position of the UI content to track the target.

items.name: CameraUIManager
items.summary: Manages the UI for a camera controller.

items.name: gameObject
items.summary: The game object for the UI components.

items.name: transform
items.summary: The transform of the UI game object.

items.name: canvas
items.summary: The canvas component that is rendering the UI.

items.name: CameraUIManager(CameraController)
items.summary: Initializes the camera UI manager for the specified controller.

parameters.description: The controller to initialize the manager for.

items.name: Dispose()
items.summary: Disposes the resources of the camera UI manager.

items.name: CameraZoom
items.summary: Changes the distance of the camera from the pivot point.

items.name: input
items.summary: The current input axis value with sensitivity applied (Read only).

items.name: percent
items.summary: The current zoom percentage in the range [0..1] (Read only).

items.name: smoothPercent
items.summary: The smoothed zoom percentage in the range [0..1] (Read only).

items.name: snappedPercent
items.summary:
The current zoom percentage snapped to the nearest increment in the
range [0..1] (Read only).

items.name: SetPercent(Single)
items.summary: Sets the zoom percentage to the given value.

parameters.description: The zoom percentage to set in the range [0..1].

items.name: ResetDistance()
items.summary: Resets the zoom percentage to the initial distance.

items.name: CameraZoomSettings
items.summary: Settings for a camera zoom behavior.

items.name: inputAxis
items.summary: The input axis name to change the camera zoom.

items.name: distanceRange
items.summary: The distance range of the camera from the pivot point.

items.name: initialDistance
items.summary: The initial distance of the camera from the pivot point.

items.name: damping
items.summary: How quickly the camera zoom changes to the intended distance.

items.name: transitionDuration
items.summary:
The amount of seconds it takes to transition zoom distance when the
camera profile is changed.

items.name: increment
items.summary: Aligns the camera zoom to set increments.

items.name: CursorState
items.summary: The cursor settings for a given state.

items.name: lockMode
items.summary: How the cursor should behave.

items.name: visible
items.summary: Shows or hides the cursor.

items.name: CursorState(CursorLockMode, Boolean)
items.summary: Creates a new cursor state.

parameters.description: How the cursor should behave.
Shows or hides the cursor.

items.name: EyelineAdjustmentSettings
items.summary: Settings for an eyeline tracker modifier.

items.name: eyelineHeight
items.summary:
The distance from the ground to the character's eyeline as a
percentage of the character's height.

items.name: damping
items.summary:
How quickly eyeline adjustments are made. Small numbers respond
more quickly to changes while large numbers respond more slowly.

items.name: FOVKickProfile
items.summary: A settings profile for a FOV "Kick" effect.

items.name: amount
items.summary: The amount of change in degrees to the camera's field of view.

items.name: kickIn
items.summary: The transition settings when the FOV "kick" is enabled.

items.name: kickOut
items.summary: The transition settings when the FOV "kick" is disabled.

items.name: FOVKickSettings
items.summary: Settings for a FOV "Kick" effect.

syntax.content:
[Serializable]
public sealed class FOVKickSettings : CameraEffectSettings<FOVKick, FOVKickProfile>

items.name: FOVKickTransition
items.summary: Settings for a FOV "Kick" transition.

items.name: duration
items.summary: The amount of seconds it takes to change the field of view.

items.name: easing
items.summary: The animation curve used when changing the field of view.

items.name: HeadBobSettings
items.summary: Settings for a head bob modifier.

items.name: amplitude
items.summary: The amount of head bob.

items.name: period
items.summary:
The speed of the head bob. This is measured in time, so smaller
values create a faster head bob.

items.name: velocityFactor
items.summary:
The percent of the character's velocity that is factored into
the speed of the head bob.

items.name: minimumVelocity
items.summary:
The minimum amount of velocity required by the character in
order for the head bob to take effect.

items.name: groundLayers
items.summary:
The layer(s) to raycast against when checking if the character
is grounded. Raycasting is only performed for rigidbodies since
character controllers have a built-in isGrounded property.

items.name: onlyGrounded
items.summary: Only bobs the head while the character is grounded.

items.name: InputAxis
items.summary: An input axis setting.

items.name: name
items.summary: The name of the input axis.

items.name: sensitivity
items.summary: The input sensitivity multiplier.

items.name: inverted
items.summary: Inverts the input axis value.

items.name: timescaled
items.summary: Scales the input axis value by delta time.

items.name: InputAxis(String, Single, Boolean, Boolean)
items.summary: Creates an input button setting with the specified name.

syntax.content: public InputAxis(string name, float sensitivity = 1F, bool inverted = false, bool timescaled = false)

parameters.description: The name of the input button.
The input sensitivity multiplier (default=1).
Inverts the input axis value (default=false).
Scales the input axis value by delta time (default=false).

items.name: IsDefined()
items.summary: Checks if the input name is not null or empty.

return.description: True if the input name is not null or empty.

items.name: Implicit(String to InputAxis)
items.summary: Implicitly converts the input name to an input axis setting.

syntax.content: public static implicit operator InputAxis(string name)

parameters.description: The name of the input axis.

items.name: InputButton
items.summary: An input button setting.

items.name: name
items.summary: The name of the input button.

items.name: InputButton(String)
items.summary: Creates an input button setting with the specified name.

parameters.description: The name of the input button.

items.name: IsDefined()
items.summary: Checks if the input name is not null or empty.

return.description: True if the input name is not null or empty.

items.name: Implicit(String to InputButton)
items.summary: Implicitly converts the input name to an input button setting.

syntax.content: public static implicit operator InputButton(string name)

parameters.description: The name of the input button.

items.name: InputHandler
items.summary: A type of input handler that reads input values from the system.

items.name: GetAxis(InputAxis)
items.summary: Gets the input value for the specified input axis.

parameters.description: The input axis to read.

return.description: The input value.

items.name: GetButtonPressed(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was pressed during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was pressed during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonReleased(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was released during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was released during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonHeld(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was held down during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was held down during this frame.

items.name: ICameraEffect
items.summary: An interface for a simulated effect that is applied to the camera.

items.name: active
items.summary: Whether the effect is currently active.

items.name: Activate()
items.summary: Activates the effect.

items.name: Deactivate()
items.summary: Deactivates the effect.

items.name: SetProfile(String)
items.summary: Sets the profile with the given name to be active.

parameters.description: The name of the profile to set active.

return.description: True if the profile was set, false otherwise.

items.name: SetProfile(Int32)
items.summary: Sets the profile at the given index to be active.

parameters.description: The index of the profile to set active.

return.description: True if the profile was set, false otherwise.

items.name: InputHandlerInputManager
items.summary: An input handler that reads input values from the legacy input manager.

items.name: Instance
items.summary: A shared instance of the input handler.

items.name: GetAxis(InputAxis)
items.summary: Gets the input value for the specified input axis.

parameters.description: The input axis to read.

return.description: The input value.

items.name: GetButtonPressed(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was pressed during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was pressed during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonReleased(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was released during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was released during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonHeld(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was held down during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was held down during this frame.

items.name: InputHandlerInputSystem
items.summary: An input handler that reads input values from the new input system.

items.name: GetAxis(InputAxis)
items.summary: Gets the input value for the specified input axis.

parameters.description: The input axis to read.

return.description: The input value.

items.name: GetButtonPressed(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was pressed during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was pressed during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonReleased(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was released during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was released during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonHeld(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was held down during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was held down during this frame.

items.name: InputHandlerNone
items.summary: An input handler that does nothing.

items.name: Instance
items.summary: A shared instance of the input handler.

items.name: GetAxis(InputAxis)
items.summary: Gets the input value for the specified input axis.

parameters.description: The input axis to read.

return.description: The input value.

items.name: GetButtonPressed(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was pressed during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was pressed during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonReleased(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was released during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was released during this frame.

items.name: GetButtonHeld(InputButton)
items.summary: Checks if the specified input button was held down during this frame.

parameters.description: The input button to read.

return.description: True if the input button was held down during this frame.

items.name: InputHandlerType
items.summary: A type of input handler.

items.name: InputSystemPackage
items.summary: Handles input using Unity's new Input System package.

items.name: LegacyInputManager
items.summary: Handles input using Unity's legacy Input Manager.

items.name: Custom
items.summary: Handles input using a custom input handler.

items.name: None
items.summary: Disables input handling.

items.name: Raycasting
items.summary: Extension methods for performing raycasts from the camera.

items.name: Raycast(Camera, out RaycastHit)
items.summary: Performs a raycast from the camera.

syntax.content: public static bool Raycast(this Camera camera, out RaycastHit hit)

parameters.description: The camera to perform the raycast from.
The raycast hit information output.

return.description: True if the raycast hit something, false otherwise.

items.name: Raycast(Camera, out RaycastHit, Single)
items.summary: Performs a raycast from the camera.

syntax.content: public static bool Raycast(this Camera camera, out RaycastHit hit, float maxDistance)

parameters.description: The camera to perform the raycast from.
The raycast hit information output.
The maximum distance the raycast can travel.

return.description: True if the raycast hit something, false otherwise.

items.name: Raycast(Camera, out RaycastHit, Single, Int32)
items.summary: Performs a raycast from the camera.

syntax.content: public static bool Raycast(this Camera camera, out RaycastHit hit, float maxDistance, int layerMask)

parameters.description: The camera to perform the raycast from.
The raycast hit information output.
The maximum distance the raycast can travel.
The layer mask to use for the raycast.

return.description: True if the raycast hit something, false otherwise.

items.name: Raycast(CameraController, out RaycastHit)
items.summary: Performs a raycast from the camera.

syntax.content: public static bool Raycast(this CameraController controller, out RaycastHit hit)

parameters.description: The camera controller to perform the raycast from.
The raycast hit information output.

return.description: True if the raycast hit something, false otherwise.

items.name: Raycast(CameraController, out RaycastHit, Single)
items.summary: Performs a raycast from the camera.

syntax.content: public static bool Raycast(this CameraController controller, out RaycastHit hit, float maxDistance)

parameters.description: The camera controller to perform the raycast from.
The raycast hit information output.
The maximum distance the raycast can travel.

return.description: True if the raycast hit something, false otherwise.

items.name: Raycast(CameraController, out RaycastHit, Single, Int32)
items.summary: Performs a raycast from the camera.

syntax.content: public static bool Raycast(this CameraController controller, out RaycastHit hit, float maxDistance, int layerMask)

parameters.description: The camera controller to perform the raycast from.
The raycast hit information output.
The maximum distance the raycast can travel.
The layer mask to use for the raycast.

return.description: True if the raycast hit something, false otherwise.

items.name: RecoilSettings
items.summary: Settings for a recoil modifier.

items.name: decayRate
items.summary:
How quickly the recoil returns to zero. The higher the value,
the faster the recoil will return to zero.

items.name: ShoulderLeanInputSettings
items.summary: Input settings for a shoulder lean modifier.

items.name: leanLeft
items.summary: The input button to lean left.

items.name: leanRight
items.summary: The input button to lean right.

items.name: ShoulderLeanSettings
items.summary: Settings for a shoulder lean modifier.

items.name: input
items.summary: The input settings.

items.name: style
items.summary: The shoulder lean style to use.

items.name: increment
items.summary: Aligns the lean direction to set increments.

items.name: animationSpeed
items.summary: The speed at which the lean direction is animated.

items.name: positionOffset
items.summary:
The distance from the center of the character to the offset lean
position in either direction.

items.name: tiltAngle
items.summary: The amount in degrees to tilt the camera while leaning.

items.name: ShoulderLeanStyle
items.summary: A type of shoulder lean style.

items.name: Continuous
items.summary: The lean is continuous while the input is held down.

items.name: Toggled
items.summary: The lean is toggled on and off with each input press.

items.name: Incremented
items.summary: The lean is snapped to the nearest increment with each input press.

items.name: ShoulderSwapInputSettings
items.summary: Input settings for a shoulder swap modifier.

items.name: swapLeft
items.summary: The input button to swap to the left shoulder.

items.name: swapRight
items.summary: The input button to swap to the right shoulder.

items.name: toggle
items.summary: The input button to swap to the opposite shoulder.

items.name: ShoulderSwapSettings
items.summary: Settings for a shoulder swap modifier.

items.name: input
items.summary: The input settings.

items.name: initialPosition
items.summary: The initial shoulder swap position in the range [-1..1].

items.name: offset
items.summary:
The distance from the center of the character to the offset
shoulder point.

items.name: angle
items.summary:
The difference in angle between shoulders. This can be used to
ensure the camera looks at the same point after swapping
shoulders.

items.name: speed
items.summary: How quickly it takes to swap shoulders.

items.name: CameraSightEvent
items.summary: Invokes an event when the camera is within a certain distance of a target.

items.name: enter
items.summary: The event invoked when the target enters sight of the camera.

items.name: exit
items.summary: The event invoked when the target exits sight of the camera.

items.name: camera
items.summary: The camera to measure the distance to.

items.name: target
items.summary: The target to check if it is within sight of the camera.

items.name: minimumDistance
items.summary: The minimum distance for the target to be considered in sight.

items.name: maximumDistance
items.summary: The maximum distance for the target to be considered in sight.

items.name: inSight
items.summary: Whether the target is currently within sight of the camera.

items.name: DrawGUITexture
items.summary: Draws a GUI texture on the screen.

items.name: texture
items.summary: The GUI texture to draw.

items.name: color
items.summary: The color of the GUI texture.

items.name: FloatRange
items.summary: A range of float values.

items.name: min
items.summary: The lower bound of the range.

items.name: max
items.summary: The upper bound of the range.

items.name: delta
items.summary: The difference between the maximum and minimum values (Read only).

items.name: FloatRange(Single, Single)
items.summary: Creates a new range with the specified values.

parameters.description: The lower bound of the range.
The upper bound of the range.

items.name: Random()
items.summary: Returns a random value in the range.

return.description: A random value in the range.

items.name: Includes(Single)
items.summary: Checks if a value is in the range.

parameters.description: The value to check.

return.description: True if the value is in the range, false otherwise.

items.name: Clamp(Single)
items.summary: Clamps a value to the range.

parameters.description: The value to clamp.

return.description: The clamped value.

items.name: Lerp(Single)
items.summary: Linearly interpolates between the range by t.

parameters.description: The interpolant value between [0..1].

return.description: The interpolated value.

items.name: InverseLerp(Single)
items.summary:
Calculates the linear parameter t that produces the interpolant
value within the range.

parameters.description: The value within the range you want to calculate.

return.description: The interpolant value between [0..1].

items.name: IKTracker
items.summary: Keeps track of the body position and rotation of an animator component.

items.name: animator
items.summary: The animator component to track.

items.name: bodyPosition
items.summary: The position of the body center of mass.

items.name: bodyRotation
items.summary: The rotation of the body center of mass.

items.name: localPosition
items.summary: The position of the body center of mass in local space.

items.name: localRotation
items.summary: The rotation of the body center of mass in local space.

items.name: Log
items.summary: Logs debug messages to the Unity console.

items.name: prefix
items.summary: The prefix identifier displayed before every log message.

items.name: enabled
items.summary: Whether debug messages should be logged to the console.

items.name: Message(String)
items.summary: Logs a message to the Unity console.

parameters.description: The message to log.

items.name: Warning(String)
items.summary: Logs a warning to the Unity console.

parameters.description: The warning to log.

items.name: Error(String)
items.summary: Logs an error to the Unity console.

parameters.description: The error to log.

items.name: QuaternionAccumulator
items.summary: Accumulates Quaternion values into a single total value.

items.name: defaultValue
items.summary: Quaternion.identity

items.name: Add(Quaternion)
items.summary: Increases the accumulated total by a given value.

parameters.description: The value to add to the total.

return.description: The new total value.

items.name: Subtract(Quaternion)
items.summary: Decreases the accumulated total by a given value.

parameters.description: The value to subtract from the total.

return.description: The new total value.

items.name: ValueAccumulator<T>
items.summary: Accumulates a set of stored values into a single total value.

typeParameters.description: The type of value to accumulate.

items.name: values
items.summary: The stored values with their given identifiers (Read only).

items.name: totalValue
items.summary: The total accumulated value (Read only).

syntax.content: public T totalValue { get; protected set; }

items.name: count
items.summary: The number of unique values being accumulated (Read only).

items.name: defaultValue
items.summary: The default value of T.

items.name: ValueAccumulator()
items.summary: Creates a new instance of the value accumulator.

items.name: GetValue(Int32)
items.summary: Returns the value stored with the specified identifier.

parameters.description: The identifier of the stored value.

return.description: The value stored with the identifier, or default(T) if the value does not exist.

items.name: SetValue(Int32, T)
items.summary:
Stores a given value with the specified identifier. The total
accumulated value is updated based on the difference between the new
and old value.

syntax.content: public void SetValue(int identifier, T value)

parameters.description: The identifier of the value.
The value to set.

items.name: RemoveValue(Int32)
items.summary:
Removes the value stored with the given identifier and updates the
total accumulated value.

parameters.description: The identifier of the stored value to remove.

items.name: Clear()
items.summary: Removes all stored values and resets the total accumulated value.

items.name: Add(T)
items.summary: Increases the accumulated total by a given value.

parameters.description: The value to add to the total.

return.description: The new total value.

items.name: Subtract(T)
items.summary: Decreases the accumulated total by a given value.

parameters.description: The value to subtract from the total.

return.description: The new total value.

items.name: Vector3Accumulator
items.summary: Accumulates Vector3 values into a single total value.

items.name: defaultValue
items.summary: Vector3.zero

items.name: Add(Vector3)
items.summary: Increases the accumulated total by a given value.

parameters.description: The value to add to the total.

return.description: The new total value.

items.name: Subtract(Vector3)
items.summary: Decreases the accumulated total by a given value.

parameters.description: The value to subtract from the total.

return.description: The new total value.

items.name: AimPunch
items.summary:
Quickly "punches" the camera's rotation in one direction then decays
back to zero. This is often used to indicate the player being hit.

syntax.content: public sealed class AimPunch : CameraEffect<AimPunchSettings, AimPunchProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: AnimatorMotion
items.summary:
Tracks the motion of the character's animator component and applies it
as a modifier to the camera.

items.name: motion
items.summary: The current animator motion being applied to the camera (Read only).

items.name: CameraEffect<T, U>
items.summary: A simulated effect that is applied to the camera.

syntax.content:
public abstract class CameraEffect<T, U> : CameraModifier<T>, ICameraEffect where T : CameraEffectSettings<U>, new()
    where U : CameraEffectProfile

typeParameters.description: The settings type to use for the effect.
The profile type to use for the effect.

items.name: profile
items.summary: The active settings profile for the effect.

items.name: active
items.summary: Whether the effect is currently active.

items.name: Activate()
items.summary: Activates the effect.

items.name: Deactivate()
items.summary: Deactivates the effect.

items.name: SetProfile(String)
items.summary: Sets the profile with the given name to be active.

parameters.description: The name of the profile to set active.

return.description: True if the profile was set, false otherwise.

items.name: SetProfile(Int32)
items.summary: Sets the profile at the given index to be active.

parameters.description: The index of the profile to set active.

return.description: True if the profile was set, false otherwise.

items.name: OnEffectActivate(U)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the effect is activated.

parameters.description: The active profile of the effect.

items.name: OnEffectDeactivate(U)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the effect is deactivated.

parameters.description: The active profile of the effect.

items.name: OnEffectRestart(U)
items.summary: A callback invoked when the effect is restarted.

parameters.description: The active profile of the effect.

items.name: CameraFade
items.summary: Fades the camera in and out.

syntax.content: public sealed class CameraFade : CameraEffect<CameraFadeSettings, CameraFadeProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: color
items.summary: The current color of the fade (Read only).

items.name: CameraShake
items.summary:
Rapidly changes the position and rotation of the camera to simulate the
camera shaking.

syntax.content: public sealed class CameraShake : CameraEffect<CameraShakeSettings, CameraShakeProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: EyelineAdjustment
items.summary: Adjusts the position of the camera to match the eyeline of the character.

items.name: FOVKick
items.summary:
Animates a subtle change in the field of view of the camera.
For example, increasing the field of view when the player sprints
creates a better feel for the faster motion.

syntax.content: public sealed class FOVKick : CameraEffect<FOVKickSettings, FOVKickProfile>, ICameraEffect

items.name: HeadBob
items.summary:
Simulates the effect of a person's head moving very slightly when
walking or running.

items.name: Recoil
items.summary:
Quickly changes the orientation of the camera to simulate recoil, such
as when shooting a gun.

items.name: amount
items.summary: The current amount of recoil (Read only).

items.name: ShoulderLean
items.summary: Handles tilting the camera to the left or right to lean around corners.

items.name: direction
items.summary: The current lean direction in the range [-1..1] (Read only).

items.name: snappedDirection
items.summary:
The current lean direction snapped to the nearest increment in the
range [-1..1] (Read only).

items.name: ShoulderSwap
items.summary:
Handles swapping the camera offset from one side of the character's
shoulders to the other.

items.name: position
items.summary: The current shoulder swap position in the range [-1..1] (Read only).
